head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 7 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: A service for the Commemoration of Gabriel of Kartamīn, on the 23d of the 1st Kānūn. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A service for the Commemoration of Gabriel of Kartamīn, on the 23d of the 1st Kānūn
msItem.rubric: ܒܫܡܐ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܦܪܘܩܢ ܟ̇ܬܒܝܢܢ ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܥܠ ܢܨܝܚܐ ܘ[ܩܕܝܫܐ] ܡܪܝ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ. ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܏ܩܕ ܕܡܪܝ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܕܩܪܬܡܝܢ ܕܒܛܘܪ ܥܒ̣̈ܕ[ܝܢ]
msItem.note: A few words, in a different hand, request a prayer for one Aaron, a priest, and his brother Phineas
msItem.quote: ܨܲܠܘ ܡܛܠ ܚܘܒܗ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܥܠ ܕܘܝܐ ܘܚܛܝܐ ܕܣܪܛ ܐܝܟ ܚܲܝܠܗ ܘܥܠ ܐܒܗ̈ܘܗܝ ܘܥܠ ܐܚܗܘ̈ܗܝ (sic) ܘܥܠ ܐܚܐ ܕܝܲܠ (sic) ܦܝܢܚܣ ܘܥܠ ܬܠܡܝܕܐ ܕܝܠܟܘܢ ܐܗܪܘܢ ܒܫܡ ܩܲܫܘܢܐ.

physDesc.p: Paper, about 6 3/4 in. by 5, consisting of 29 leaves, the first of which is slightly stained and torn. The quires, signed with letters, are four in number. There are from 13 to 17 lines in each page. This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the xiiith cent.

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, are four in number.

item.p: 29 leaves, the first of which is slightly stained and torn.

layout.p: There are from 13 to 17 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the xiiith cent.
A few words, in a different hand, request a prayer for one Aaron, a priest, and his brother Phineas.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The colophon states that it was written for one rabban Bar-saumā

p.quote: ܨܲܠܘ ܡܛܠ ܚܘܒܗ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ ܥܠ ܕܘܝܐ ܘܚܛܝܐ ܕܣܪܛ ܐܝܟ ܚܲܝܠܗ ܘܥܠ ܐܒܗ̈ܘܗܝ. ܘܥ̈ܠ ܪܒܢ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܘܥ̈ܠ ܐܒܗ̈ܘܗܝ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܝ̣ܨܦ ܕܢܬܟ̣ܬܒ ܘ܏ܫ.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Ascribed to Jacob of Batnae. A metrical discourse on Gabriel of Kartamīn. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A metrical discourse on Gabriel of Kartamīn
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ ܨܠܘܬܗ ܥܡܢ ܐܡܝܢ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘ܏ܬܬܥܘ. ܐܠܗܐ ܒܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܪܕܝ ܠܢ ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Paper, about 6 1/2 in. by 4 1/2, consisting of 34 leaves, of which the first and the last two are much torn. The quires, signed with letters, are 5 in number, but the first is imperfect at the beginning. There are from 14 to 19 lines in each page. This manuscript, which is written in an inelegant hand, with numerous Greek and Syriac vowels, and dated A. Gr. 1876, A.D. 1565

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, are 5 in number, but the first is imperfect at the beginning.

item.p: 34 leaves, of which the first and the last two are much torn.

layout.p: There are from 14 to 19 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript, which is written in an inelegant hand, with numerous Greek and Syriac vowels, and dated A. Gr. 1876, A.D. 1565

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a life ofBasil of Caesarea, perhaps that ascribed to his successor Helladius. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of a life of Basil of Caesarea, perhaps that ascribed to his successor Helladius

msItem.rubric: ܬܕܡܘܪܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܘܣ ܡܛܠ ܚܙܘܐ ܕܐܒܘܢ ܐܦܪܝܡ. ܠܐ ܟܬܝܒܐ ܒܕܘܟܬܗ̇
ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܐܢܬܬܐ ܕܐܫܬܒ̣ܩ ܠܗ̇ ܚ̈ܛܗܗ (sic) ܒܝܕ ܨ̈ܠܘܬܗ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܒܣܝܠܝܘܣ

physDesc.p: Four paper leaves, about 6 5/8 in. by 5 1/8, all more or less stained and torn. The number of lines in each page varies from 22 to 25. The writing is good and regular, apparently of the xiith cent.

item.p: All leaves more or less stained and torn

layout.p: The number of lines in each page varies from 22 to 25.

handDesc.handNote: The writing is good and regular, apparently of the xiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: An account of a Letter that was sent down from Heaven to the church of S. Paul at Constantinople, in the year 1057 (A.D. 746). In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: An account of a Letter that was sent down from Heaven to the church of S. Paul at Constantinople, in the year 1057 (A.D. 746)
msItem.rubric: . . . ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚـ[ـܐ] ܟܬ[ܒܝـ]ـܢܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܢܚܬܬ ܡܢ ܫܡܝܐ܀ ܬܫܒܘܚܬܐ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܒܡܪ̈ܘܡܐ. [ܘܥܠ] ܐܪܥܐ ܫܠܡܐ. ܘܣܒܪܐ ܛ̇ܒܐ ܠܒܢܝـ[ـܢ̈ܫܐ.] ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܚܡ̈ܫܝܢ ܘܫ̈ܒܥ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ ܒܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܝܐܪܚܐ ܢܝـ[ـܣܢ] ܐܬܚ̣ܙܝܬ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܒܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܐܦܘܠܝܣ. ܟܕ ܥܡܐ ܣ̇ܓܝܐܐ ܟܢܝ̣ܫ ܗܘܐ ܒܗܝܟܠܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܐ ܕܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ. ܟܗ̈ܢܐ ܘܡܫ̈ܡܫܢܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.quote: ܘܟܬܝܒ ܒܐܓܪܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܗܟܢܐ. ܕܫܕܪܬ ܠܘܬܟܘܢ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܐܚܪܝܬܐ̣. ܘܠܐ ܥܒ̣ܕܬܘܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܡܐ ܕܐܝܬܘܐ (sic) ܒܗ̇. ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܘܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܘܣ. ܘܫܕܪܬ ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܚ̈ܡܫܝܢ. ܕܬܬܘܒܘܢ ܡܢ ܥ̣ܒ̈ܕܝܟܘܢ ܒܝ̈ܫ̣ܐ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: In the letter itself allusion is made to previous letters of the year 1042 and 1050.
Cf. Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. iii., pars i, p. 638, cod. Arab, xviii. ; Dillmann's Catal. of the AEtbiopic MSS. in the Bodleian Library, p. 13, cod. xiv., A; Praetorius, Mazbafa Tomār, Leipzig, 1869

physDesc.p: Seven paper leaves, about 7 3/4 in. by 5, several of which are slightly torn. There are from 13 to 15 lines in each page. They are written in an inelegant hand of the xiiith cent.

layout.p: There are from 13 to 15 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: Written in an inelegant hand of the xiiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Services for various festivals, comprising ܥܛܪ̈ܐ, ܣܕܪ̈ܐ, ܦܪ̈ܘܡܝܘܢ, ܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ, ܚܘ̈ܬܡܐ. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 11 items.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Greek canons of the 3d, 4th, and 5th tones. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Greek canons of the 3d, 4th, and 5th tones

physDesc.p: Six paper leaves, about 6 7/8 in. by 5, numbered with Coptic arithmetical figures from 𐋳𐋱𐋣 (183) to 𐋳𐋱𐋨 (188). There are from 18 to 20 lines in each page.

collation.p: Six paper leaves, about 6 7/8 in. by 5, numbered with Coptic arithmetical figures from 𐋳𐋱𐋣 (183) to 𐋳𐋱𐋨 (188).

layout.p: There are from 18 to 20 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good hand of the xiiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a Greek canon. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

physDesc.p: Seven paper leaves, about 6 7/8 in. by 4 7/8, the last of which is much torn. They contain part of a Greek canon, written in a good Malkite hand of the xiiith cent., with 15 lines in each page.

item.p: The last leaf is much torn

handDesc.handNote: Written in a good Malkite hand of the xiiith cent.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Syro-Arabic garshunography in East Syriac script

ADDED: added missing locus information for msItems
CHANGED: updated incorrect form and/or material support designation
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
One or more msParts need to be encoded into an historical reconstruction of a no longer extant manuscript..
